intro: Linosyris parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved linosyris, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It has small, narrow leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Linosyris parvifolia is often used in rock gardens due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
